question: Which of the following is correct about the speed of the sound, at same temperature?
option1: sound travels faster in humid air than in dry air
option2: sound travels slower in humid air than in dry air
option3: speed of sound is same in humid air and dry air
answer: sound travels faster in humid air than in dry air
explanation: With increase in humidity, density of air decreases. So with rise in humidity velocity of sound increases. This is why sound travels faster in humid air (rainy season) than in dry air (summer) at the same temperature.
